name: Pistol Squat
how_to_perform:
1. Stand with your feet hip-width apart and arms relaxed by your sides. Choose one leg to be your standing leg and lift the opposite leg off the ground slightly in front of you.
   
2. Extend your arms straight out in front of you for balance. Make sure to engage your core muscles and keep your chest upright throughout the movement.
   
3. Begin bending your standing leg at the knee and hip while keeping your other leg extended in front of you.
   
4. Lower yourself slowly into a squat position, aiming to bring your hips as low as possible while maintaining good form and balance.
   
5. Keep your standing heel flat on the ground and make sure your knee tracks over your foot, not collapsing inward or outward.
   
6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the squat, keeping tension in your muscles.
   
7. Press firmly through your standing heel and begin to rise back up to the starting position, extending your knee and hip until you are standing upright again.
   
8. Throughout the movement, keep your raised leg as straight as possible without locking the knee.

9. Lower your raised leg back to the ground and repeat for the desired number of repetitions.

10. Switch legs and repeat on the opposite side.
short_summary: The pistol squat is a challenging single-leg squat exercise that enhances strength, balance, and mobility.
